newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU vets Go-Ahead/VIA-GTI Thameslink deal.
newsitem.headline: EU vets Go-Ahead/VIA-GTI Thameslink deal.

text.p: The European Commission said on Tuesday it was starting a routine probe into the proposed joint control of Thameslink Rail Ltd by transport firms Go-Ahead Group Plc of Britain and France's Via Generale de Transport et d'Industrie (VIA-GTI).

The two companies won in February a seven-year franchise to run Thameslink, a British rail transport company which operates services between Bedford and Luton to the north of London and Brighton on the south coast, connecting Gatwick Airport with northern and central London.

Go-Ahead operates bus and rail transport services in Britain only. Via-GTI operates in Spain, Germany, Belgium and Hungary besides France. It is ultimately controlled by Compagnie Financiere de Paribas.
The joint venture created to operate Thameslink would be owned 65 percent by Go-Ahead and 35 percent by the French partner.

The Commission said in a notice to be published in the EU's Official Journal that the deal was submitted for clearance on March 18 under the Union's merger regulation which bans creation or strengthening of dominant positions.
It has a month from that date to clear the operation or start a full probe.
